thread.title: Baltimore Ravens' Tight End Dennis Pitta Says If He Doesn't Return This Year, He Might Retire
thread.title_full: Baltimore Ravens' Tight End Dennis Pitta Says If He Doesn't Return This Year, He Might Retire

author: Louis Milman
title: Baltimore Ravens' Tight End Dennis Pitta Says If He Doesn't Return This Year, He Might Retire
text:
Photo by Allen Berezovsky/WireImage (BALTIMORE) -- Baltimore Ravens tight end Dennis Pitta says he will decide in the coming weeks whether his return from a hip injury will ever allow him to play again.Pitta returned to practice with the team on Thursday for the first time in 13 months. Coach Harbaugh announces that TE Dennis Pitta will practice today for the first time this season. — Baltimore Ravens (@Ravens) October 21, 2015 
Pitta fractured and dislocated his hip last September for the second time in two years. Pitta first injured the hip in training camp before the 2013 season and returned to action in four months."I'd like to think that if I can't make it back this year, then what's going to change next year," Pitta told reporters Thursday. "For me, in my mind, I'm working to get back this year. If I can't then that might be it."Pitta has three weeks to get up to speed and be activated to the active roster or else he would have to be placed on season-long injured reserve.
